summary: This document is a 30-minute inmate observation check sheet from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. It records staff checks on an inmate in continuous locked-down status, likely Jeffrey Epstein, on the day of his death. The sheet includes signatures for three watch periods and is reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks in SHU
events.description: Staff at MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted 30-minute observation checks on an inmate in continuous locked-down status throughout the day and night.

keyFacts: This is a prison check sheet from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 10, 2019.
The sheet documents 30-minute observation rounds for an inmate in continuous locked-down status, consistent with protocols for high-profile or at-risk inmates.
The document is signed by Lieutenants for Morning Watch, Day Watch, and Evening Watch operations, and reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The date (August 10, 2019) corresponds to the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York.
The check sheet itself is a routine prison administrative document used to log inmate welfare checks.
